pros: Loved the team I worked with, as well as the functions I performed. Excellent community building.
cons: Sometimes had unrealistic expectations of employees.

pros: Consistent scheduling, easy to work with management, customers often frequent and are generally polite. Good food, good as a first job.
cons: You are not allowed to receive tips from residents

job_title: Patient Safety Sitter in Woodstock, GA
pros: Love the residents, the employees, the care the company give us. Great end of year bonuses. Caregiver resident ratio is great as well
cons: Do not allow PTO give away for those in need due to medical issues, bad idea!!!

review_title: Works hard to fulfill their mission to end relationship and sexual abuse
job_title: Client Advocate in Saratoga Springs, NY
pros: Solid track record of growth in breadth and depth of services offered. Mission driven with considerable ethical concern
cons: While salaries are somewhat higher than at other human service agencies, they are still too low to attract and keep many younger employees for the long term.

pros: You are appreciated by residents and senior employees alike. Open door policy provides transparency.
cons: Policy and procedures for handling complaints seems one sided.

job_title: Home Care CNA in Greensboro, NC
pros: Great interaction with the residents and other employees
cons: Home Care does not offer paid time off and benefits are not available until a year after being hired as a full time employee.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Greensboro, NC
pros:
-get to make your own schedule 
-only with one resident per shift 
-very helpful office staff 
-nice facility 
-very clean
cons: -there are a lot of CNAs, so you sometimes have to fight to get extra shifts

pros: You don't work as hard and the pay is good
cons: not enough openings for full time
